title: Add dedicated Blogs section (backend + UI)

requirements.text: Add backend support for a dedicated Blogs feature that is separate from existing Articles: define a new `BlogPost` type and implement public query APIs to list blog posts and fetch a single blog post by id, plus admin-only CRUD APIs to create, update, and delete blog posts.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a new `BlogPost` record type distinct from `Article`.
Backend exposes query methods to: (1) list blog posts, (2) get a blog post by id; both are maintenance-gated like other public content.
Backend exposes admin-only methods to: add, update, and delete blog posts, following the same admin authorization pattern as `addArticle/updateArticle/deleteArticle`.
Blog post ids are generated on the backend (monotonically increasing) similar to Articles/ResearchPapers/Feedback.

requirements.text: Add a new public Blogs UI section with routing: implement a `BlogsPage` at route `/blogs` that displays a list of blog posts, and implement a blog detail page at route `/blogs/$id` that renders a single blog post by id with appropriate loading/empty/error states.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to `/blogs` shows a blog list UI that loads from the backend and handles loading and empty states.
Navigating to `/blogs/<id>` shows a detail view for that blog post (title + content) and handles missing ids (not found state).
Routes are wired into `frontend/src/App.tsx` using the existing TanStack Router pattern used for `/articles`, `/research`, etc.

requirements.text: Update the global navigation to include the new Blogs section: add a top-level nav item labeled "Blogs" that routes to `/blogs`, matching the existing Header navigation behavior on both desktop and mobile menus.
acceptanceCriteria: Header shows a "Blogs" nav item alongside existing items (Home, Learn Finance, Glossary, Articles, etc.).
The mobile sheet navigation also includes "Blogs".
Active-route styling works consistently when the current path is `/blogs` or a blog detail route.

requirements.text: Add React Query hooks for Blogs in `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` to fetch the blog list and individual blog posts by id, following the existing patterns used for articles and research papers.
acceptanceCriteria: A query hook exists to fetch the blog list from the backend and is used by `/blogs`.
A query hook exists to fetch a single blog post by id and is used by `/blogs/$id`.
Hooks are disabled until the backend actor is available, consistent with existing hooks.

constraints: Backend must remain a single-actor Motoko canister; all Motoko logic must live in `backend/main.mo`.
Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (shadcn components must be composed, not modified).
Do not modify immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`).
Use English for any user-facing text added in the Blogs UI.
nonGoals: Do not replace or redesign the existing Articles section; Blogs must be a separate content type and route.
Do not add third-party CMS integrations or external databases.
Do not implement real-time features (e.g., live comments) for blogs.
